content: Absolutely love this bracelet set, the matching necklaces too! I have extremely sensitive skin, so much I cannot wear due to my sensitivities, so I normally stay away from fashion/less expensive jewelry. I absolutely loved this though when I saw it and decided to go for it because you cant beat that price, and if it didnt work out I could always return it. I have had absolutely zero issues with the bracelet or necklace causing a breakout/rash of any kind!! And each time I wear them I get so many compliments! Now to hold, they are light and dont feel expensive, but looks wise, they very well couldve cost a few hundred dollars, they dont look cheap at all. And theyve held up nicely, still look the same today as they did when I purchased them a few months ago. I make sure to take them off before I workout, shower, sleep and keep them in a jewelry catchall. Im super pleased with my purchase. I would purchase again, whether it be for me or as a gift for someone. Dont hesitate with this one, buy now!

content:
Bought several of these as caprices.  They fit great! Love the style.  I also bought a pair of denim type long pants.  They were really great and were long enough for me - about 31" inseam.

I went back today and picked up a black, tan, and another denim pair of long paints.  The black and tan were 29" inseam and the denim are 31" inseam.  This is an issue with me as a 30" inseam would be acceptable.  I will have to let out the hem and add fabric to make a new hem to make these not ankle pants.

Also I really appreciate the pocket.  It is on the small side, but my phone will fit barely.  If they made it about 1/2 " wider it would be much better.

raw_content:

content: I've now bought 6 pairs of these leggings, plus one pair of the Capri-length of these.  I buy 2X in these, as I previously wore in the Faded Glory brand.  The "floating" elastic waistband in these is not as comfortable, and 2 of the pairs, though sized as 2x, had much tighter elastic, and not as comfortable as the rest.  To me, leggings should be fitted all the way down to the ankle, but these are quite a bit roomier than I'd like, and tend to bag around the ankles.  Yes, I AM short...just under 5 ft., but it would be better if the legs of these "leggings" were tapered for a more appropriate fit.  The saving grace for me is the price....and now that I must wear compression wraps (which are bulky) on both legs, ankle to knee, they are not as obvious under the looser legs of these "leggings".....hence the 4-star rating.

content: Instant fan of this brand. I love how thin and light the material is without compromising the quality. Breathable, soft, and comfy all around. It isn't the warmest for outdoor use, but it's perfect for getting cozy inside the house during this chilly California winter. I am NOT a size 1X, but I am a fan of the "baggy" look with these sorts of sweaters. The way the raglan sleeves are designed make it perfect for rolling up if you like that look. Consider pairing this with a slouchy beanie for that "doing nothing all day" look like I do! I have not noticed any deterioration or shedding after just over a week of use and a couple washes. So far so good, would recommend for a light sweater. Perhaps pair it with a jacket for outdoor use especially if you live in the cold. I am a 5'8 150lb male if you'd like to reference the pictures.

content: I have never felt a more softer sweatshirt, than the Terra & Sky Women's plus size fleece athleisure sweatshirt. The fleece makes your body feel like you're wrapped in a cloud. content: I'm going to say it right up front that I USUALLY do not like or wear sweatshirts. I run pretty warm as it is and I live in Florida so usually I can wear sweatpants and a tshirt and hoodie and be fine on the coldest days we get. BUT, you guys, this sweatshirt? This sweatshirt is amazing. It's not like the other sweatshirts. It's made of the softest fleece ever. It feels AMAZING against your skin. Like clouds. I got this in a size 2XL because I prefer my shirts a bit baggy and the size was right on. Not too big or small. Exactly what I expected of a 2XL. I will absolutely be looking for and buying some sweatpants in this same brand and material because it really is that soft and comfortable. As someone who truly hasn't worn a sweatshirt in a decade because like I said I just am always hot but also because they're usually too stiff and uncomfortable to me. This has changed my mind on that. I didn't overheat when I wore it and found it so super comfortable. If you want sweatshirts or pants in a warm fleece but don't like how bulky some sweat materials are then you deserve it to give these a try.

content:
This skirt is functional and looks nice enough  but I really dislike the waistband. It is constructed of a wide piece of elastic that is sewn on along one edge of the opened waistband then folded over and tacked down along the side seams. It rolls on my short waisted torso when I sit. I ordered this one in XL. Unsure of the size I need I also ordered a L in navy. The navy skirt had a normal sewn on waistband with no chunky elastic.

My biggest issue is that the product page indicates that it may be returned to the store. That is very misleading. You may have Walmart print a return label at the store, but you must mail it back yourself.

content: I agree with Tina that they shouldn't have changed a good thing.  The length and feel of the fabric on these is still great, but they did change the adjustable straps on these.  You used to be able to adjust these all the way to the front, if needed, to accommodate those with sloped shoulders... and now the adjustable part is a very small section that doesn't go up high enough to keep the straps from falling down anymore.   I do hope they change the straps back to how they used to be.  These are perfect tanks otherwise.
raw_content: I agree with Tina that they shouldn't have changed a good thing. The length and feel of the fabric on these is still great, but they did change the adjustable straps on these. You used to be able to adjust these all the way to the front, if needed, to accommodate those with sloped shoulders... and now the adjustable part is a very small section that doesn't go up high enough to keep the straps from falling down anymore. I do hope they change the straps back to how they used to be. These are perfect tanks otherwise.

content: I bought several shirts for my kids, some of the x-temp and some nano. The difference between the two types, size-wise was ridiculously huge! The small in x-temp were the same size as the xs in the nano! The xs in the x-temp looks more like a 2T-3T, while the xs nano is more accurately a 5-6. These shirts are out of the bag new, not washed. Fabric is soft and the quality of the garment is great. The incredible inconvenience of this drastic size differentiation drops the value to 2 stars. My kids are a 6-7 and and 4T-5T. While the nano shirts will be great, the x-temp are WAY too small! (Pictured are the XS in both styles)

content: Discovered this brand last year and bought these sweatshirts in every color. They held up very well through the season to daily wearing and multiple washings, I was impressed by how little they faded or shrunk, and I was so happy to have found an affordable brand of decent quality. Came back this year to buy new colors and replace ones that I managed to stain or rip last year. Sadly they are not as good quality this year. The sizing and fit are the same (unlike the sweatpants) but the fabric is noticeably thinner and lighter in weight. These sweatshirt will not going to keep you warm on those north east cold winter days even layered with a turtleneck, but they are still great for mid season and/or southern winters. For those complaining about fuzzies and lint, this kind of fabric does shed for until its been worn and washed a few times - not the end of the world, it is normal.

I prefer to hand wash and air dry my t-shirts; the color in the material does not bleed or fade. I especially like the crew neck style in this item because I can actually add some bling or embellishments such as small beads or sequence around the neck area to wear with slacks for office wear. The t-shirt is a nice addition to casual or office wear, comes in pretty colors, and the price is decent too.

content:
I like the waistband, the fabric, and the pockets. I really dislike the trend of using ribbed cuffs at the bottom of pants, because it's not elastic enough for legs. I can't pull the leg of my pants up to my knee!

These would be perfect if the leg opening at the ankle was simply elastic, like they used to have them in the 80s. 

Also, the pant legs are kind of short. I don't want to wear pants all bunched up like in the photo. Seems like the other trend is to turn all lounge pants into capri pants.

content: I ordered 2 of these dresses and I was very pleased when they came in. They were very soft and fit beautifully. I was a little nervous as I read the reviews but this is how you can keep your dresses in good condition: either hand wash them or machine wash on gentle cycle using either Woolite or a baby detergent; wash inside out and hang to dry. Do not use harsh sulfates or harsh water on the material. It is modal which is the softest of cottons, but it will pill easily if not cared for properly. But if you take care of it, it will last. These dresses are lovely and can be dressed up with heels or down with high top sneakers! I liked the 2 so much and got so many compliments on them that I went back and bought 2 more! Well worth the money! I gave 4 stars out of 5 because they do require special care.

content: These are thin and lightweight, but still warm longjohns. They fit true to size and you can't really tell that you're wearing them (which is great for comfort). They aren't big and bulky like the old-school longjohns. They fit nice and snug and help keep the warmth in. That being said, I got these when it was pretty warm out, so I haven't really been able to put these to a good (cold) test. I also like that they have a fly - some men's longjohns don't have a fly!
raw_content:
These are thin and lightweight, but still warm longjohns. They fit true to size and you can't really tell that you're wearing them (which is great for comfort). They aren't big and bulky like the old-school longjohns. They fit nice and snug and help keep the warmth in. That being said, I got these when it was pretty warm out, so I haven't really been able to put these to a good (cold) test. I also like that they have a fly - some men's longjohns don't have a fly!

A couple weird points: 1) the package says "2PC Pants" which I just assumed meant that there were two pieces in the package - not true, just one (seems a little deceptive), and 2) these were requested through Walmart, but shipped from Amazon in Amazon packaging (not sure how that happens!).

I definitely recommend this product to friends and families, looking forward to buying it again.

content: I have bought a few pieces of athletic wear for my husband from Walmart that he wears as underclothes much of the time. What he needed was some thermal pants that would not be bulky under his jeans. These Thermajohn's work! He tried them on and really liked multiple things about them. He mentioned the material is comfortable and warm. The fit was right as he usually wears an xl and the xl fits. He was happy with the comfort of the waistband and didn't feel it was neither too snug or too lose. If he said anything he didn't like it was just that the ankles felt a little tight but he liked that wind wouldn't blow up into them if he wears them while jogging with shorts over-top the thermal pants. I know now to get the matching shirt so he has the full thermal suit to wear. Especially since he told me the material doesn't seem to hold smells from sweating a lot in them. I have washed them once or twice and the fabric seemed to hold up nicely. Overall, my husband likes these and I'm hoping the Thermajohn brand will just be my easy go-to for his underclothes.

content: I got the Thermajohn Mens Thermal Pants in grey for a non-biased review. These are a nice light/medium grey color and as stated very soft. They are extremely soft inside and out. I even wore them for 24 hours and the comfort never swayed. They have also stayed up very well. I don't have to continue to pull them up. They are breathable, yet very warm. I have worn them outside under my jeans or work pants and they have definitely helped to keep me warm. I would wear these in anywhere from 20-60 degree weather. I have also worn them inside and I haven't gotten too hot or sweaty in them. They are made with polyester and spandex and are stretchy, yet very comfortable. I'm 6 foot, 190 lbs, 34 sized pants and a Large fits very well. They aren't too small or too big. See the pictures I uploaded to see sizing. My legs are smaller, muscular, but thinner than some. They have washed up well and the quality seems to be very nice. I think they will last me some time. I am very happy with these and I would definitely purchase this brand for more thermal clothing or other clothing.

content: These thermal bottoms by Thermajohn are great for extreme cold winter days. The cold generally doesn't bother young blood, but folks that are older and getting on, the cold winter outdoors are felt more.
raw_content:
These thermal bottoms by Thermajohn are great for extreme cold winter days. The cold generally doesn't bother young blood, but folks that are older and getting on, the cold winter outdoors are felt more.

Wearing these thermal compression bottoms underneath jeans or trousers is almost like having a second skin, as it contours around the legs keeping heat loss to a minimum which is the main feature described. The inner side has flatlock seams and feels fleecy and soft reducing irritation and discomfort. It is also breathable and wicks away any sweat by absorbing, and helps that it has anti-odor attributes as well. What makes it comfortable is that it is stretchy in all directions so it doesn't feel tight because of the spandex properties but does feel snug and comfy with no restrictions to movement. For blokes, the open fly makes bathroom visits a tad easier altho it's obviously another layer to get to.

Overall, it's snuggly, extremely lightweight, comfy, and stretchy. With these underneath you can embrace and endure the harsh cold winter days and get on with your day without being uncomfortable. Highly recommend these thermal bottoms. Just need to get a matching thermal top to go with these bottoms for total comfort.

content: I do a lot of outside activities and like to dress according to the weather, with the ability to take layers on or off as needed. I tried these thermal pants, more for slightly cooler days/nights no lower than 32, but not above 50 degrees. Since I wear slimmer fitting jeans, I was hoping they would fit snuggly; they did. These fit very well, almost like a second skin, but giving as needed. There is no bulk to them and the material allowed my body to retain the heat outside, but release it whenever I went into a building or it warmed up closer to 50 degrees. I would suggest that you wear no other undergarments, as it would defeat the purpose of trying to lose the bulk, maintain a balanced temperature, and most undergarments would impact the comfortability of the pants. They are exceptional soft, both inside and out. I washed them six times, with no negative effect on the material and it's wearing comfort. It has a great blend of 92% ultra-soft polyester and 8% spandex. The elastic waistband is very stretch, but comfortable. When ordering, I suggest you order by length, more so than by waistline. I've included a picture to help you see what a Large size measures out to be after six washings; the spandex really allows it to stretch out for your waist and leg size, not so much the length. Get the size larger if you are concerned, but the length may be not to your liking; I wish they posted the inseam length. My Large measured: Waist 15 - 22", Length top to bottom 36", and Inseam length 25". They also handwash up easily, fast air drying, and pack up to the size a bit larger than a softball. Bottomline: they are snug fitting, lightweight, comfortable, and help balance the lower body temperature. I've already bought another pair for myself and two for my wife; haven't decided on the shirt yet.
